excerpt: Extensive landscaped gardens with a riverside observation tower & ponds home to flamingos & herons.
detail_description: Mangal das Garças is a breathtaking park nestled in the heart of Belem's Cidade Velha, just behind the Navy Arsenal. This urban oasis boasts beautifully landscaped gardens that feature serene ponds and an observation tower overlooking the Rio Guama. Visitors can marvel at a variety of indigenous birds, including flamingos and herons, while strolling along modern boardwalks and enjoying picturesque views across the river.
name: Mangal das Garças
address: R. Carneiro da Rocha, s/n - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-160, Brazil

excerpt: Converted dock warehouses offering trendy eateries, shops, bars & live cultural events.
detail_description: Estação das Docas, located in Belém, is a renovated complex of 19th-century steel cargo warehouses that have been transformed into a modern hub for dining, shopping, and cultural experiences. The airy and trendy space houses boutiques, bookstores, bars, cafes, gourmet restaurants, art galleries, a theater, and a cinema. With large glass walls offering views of the docks and the river, it has become one of the city's most popular hangout spots.
name: Estação das Docas
address: Av. Mal. Hermes, S/N - Campina, Belém - PA, 66010-020, Brazil

excerpt: Longtime destination for food & medicinal herbs sold in historic buildings & an open-air market.
detail_description: Begin your day in Belem with a visit to the iconic Mercado Ver-o-Peso, where you'll find an impressive variety of products from the Amazon rainforest and rivers. The market is a vibrant mosaic of colors, aromas, and flavors that are characteristic of the Para region. Explore historic buildings and an open-air market selling food and medicinal herbs. Your guide will introduce you to local vendors and share interesting insights about regional produce like cassava leaves and tucupi juice.
name: Mercado Ver-o-Peso
address: Blvd. Castilhos França - Campina, Belém - PA, 66013-030, Brazil

name: Feliz Lusitânia-Complex
address: R. Siqueira Mendes, 2-240 - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-600, Brazil

excerpt: Belém, capital of the state of Pará, is a port city and gateway to Brazil’s lower Amazon region. By Guajará Bay, the riverfront district Cidade Velha (old town) preserves Portuguese-colonial architecture, including churches, colorful azulejo-tile houses and a 17th-century fortification known as Forte do Presépio. Ver-o-Peso is a vast, open-air market on the water selling Amazonian fish, fruit and handicrafts.
detail_description: Belém, the capital of Pará, is a vibrant port city that serves as the gateway to Brazil's lower Amazon region. The riverfront district of Cidade Velha boasts well-preserved Portuguese-colonial architecture, including churches and colorful azulejo-tile houses. The 17th-century Forte do Presépio stands as a testament to the city's history.
name: Belém
address: State of Pará, Brazil

detail_description: Theatro da Paz, or Peace Theatre, is a renowned neoclassical-style theater located in Belem, Para, Brazil. Built between 1869 and 1874 during the Para rubber boom, it features a beautiful facade with imposing stone columns and Italianate finishings. The interior boasts precious woods, gilt mirrors, crystal chandeliers, and glossy Italian marble.
name: Theatro da Paz
address: Avenida da Paz, Praça da República, S/N - Campina, Belém - PA, 66017-060, Brazil

detail_description: If you're seeking a delightful day trip, look no further than Ilha do Combu, an enchanting island nestled in the Guama River. Just a short boat ride from the city, this lush paradise is celebrated for its rich cacao and acai production. Upon arrival, make your way to Dona Nena's chocolate factory where you can immerse yourself in the fascinating process of chocolate-making using locally sourced cacao. Indulge in free samples and discover unique products to take home.
name: Ilha do Cumb
address: Outeiro, Belém - State of Pará, Brazil

excerpt: Sprawling urban botanical garden & nature preserve featuring abundant flora & fauna.
detail_description: Bosque Rodrigues Alves - Amazon Zoobotanical Garden, located in Belem, Para, Brazil, is one of the oldest botanical gardens in the country. Spanning 40 acres, it houses diverse collections of flora including cacti, succulent plants, orchids, coniferous trees and medicinal plants. The garden also features lakes, waterfalls, caves and a small zoo with turtles. Visitors can experience the Amazon rainforest firsthand within the city at this urban nature preserve.
name: Bosque Rodrigues Alves - Amazon Zoobotanical Garden
address: Av. Alm. Barroso, 2305 - Marco, Belém - PA, 66093-034, Brazil

excerpt: Venerable research institution & museum with a zoological & botanical park, plus artifact exhibits.
detail_description: Zoobotanical Park - Emílio Goeldi Museum is a renowned research institution and museum located in Belem, Para, Brazil. Established in the mid-1860s, it forms part of the Parque Zoobotanico complex and has become a significant research facility. The museum showcases Indian artifacts such as vibrant 'Marajoara' pottery crafted by the indigenous Marajo Indians. However, its main attractions are the Brazilian animals and zoo gardens, particularly the monkeys.
name: Zoobotanical Park - Emílio Goeldi Museum
address: Av. Gov Magalhães Barata, 376 - São Braz, Belém - PA, 66040-170, Brazil

excerpt: Leafy space with a monument to a coup of 1889, ornate colonial-era buildings & a Sunday craft fair.
detail_description: Praça da República is a charming leafy square in the heart of Belem, featuring a monument to the republic and ornate colonial-era buildings. The wide triangle-shaped park is shaded by mango trees and tall bamboos, offering a peaceful retreat from the sun. Visitors can stroll through the historic green space, admire the iconic Teatro da Paz, and explore a Sunday craft fair showcasing local goods.
name: Praça da República
address: Av. Pres. Vargas, 814 - Campina, Belém - PA, 66017-060, Brazil

excerpt: Neoclassical basilica built in 1909, with ornate stained-glass windows & glittering mosaics.
detail_description: The Basilica Sanctuary of Our Lady of Nazareth, a stunning neoclassical masterpiece completed in 1909, is an architectural gem that captivates visitors with its grandeur. Nestled in the heart of Belém, Brazil, this basilica features intricate stained-glass windows and dazzling mosaics that adorn its opulent interior crafted entirely from European marble.
name: Basilica Sanctuary of Our Lady of Nazareth
address: Av. Nª Sra. de Nazaré, 1300 - Nazaré, Belém - PA, 66035-145, Brazil

detail_description: Cultural Center Casa das Onze Janelas is a captivating art museum located on the banks of the Guama River in Belem. It features a diverse collection of classical and modern art, including paintings, sculptures, and photography. The center was originally a house owned by a Sugar Baron and later served as a military hospital before being transformed into an art museum. Visitors can also enjoy dining at Saulo's restaurant within the complex.
name: Cultural Center Casa das Onze Janelas
address: R. Siqueira Mendes - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-600, Brazil

name: Estádio Banpará Curuzu
address: Av. Alm. Barroso, 654 - Marco, Belém - PA, 66093-971, Brazil

detail_description: The museum Palacete Bolonha is a remarkably exquisite and mesmerizing historical edifice located in Belem. Its construction was commissioned by the Duck as an expression of his deep love for his cherished spouse in days gone by. The palace boasts impeccable intricacies and flawlessness, rendering it truly breathtaking to behold. A visit to this exceptional landmark is highly recommended when exploring Belem.
name: Palacete Bolonha
address: Av. Gov. José Malcher, 295 - Nazaré, Belém - PA, 66035-065, Brazil

detail_description: The art gallery Gotazkaen is a trendy establishment that consistently accommodates our preferences and fulfills our desires in one location. The prices are reasonable for both the delectable cuisine and affordable beer options. Although it does not have a permanent location, it periodically changes venues but always returns with great offerings. The gallery holds significant reverence among residents of Belem.
name: Gotazkaen
address: R. Caetano Rufino, 84 - Campina, Belém - PA, 66015-070, Brazil

detail_description: Cemitério de Nossa Senhora da Soledade, also known as the Memorial Park, is a significant cultural site in Belém, Brazil. It holds historical value and serves as a reminder of Amazonian traditions and navigation. This park is situated close to other notable attractions such as Mangal das Garcas and the Seringal Park Museum.
name: Cemetery Park of Soledade
address: Av. Serzedelo Corrêa, 514 - Batista Campos, Belém - PA, 66033-265, Brazil

excerpt: Urban lakefront recreational hub with sprawling green space & bicycling & walking trails.
detail_description: Utinga State Park is a stunning urban oasis that spans over 1,300 hectares, offering a delightful escape into nature right in the heart of Belém. This park serves as both a recreational hub and an essential water source for the city, making it a vital part of the local ecosystem. Visitors can explore its extensive network of walking and biking trails that meander around Lake Agua Preta, providing breathtaking views and opportunities to connect with diverse wildlife.
name: Utinga State Park
address: Av. João Paulo II, S/N - Curió-Utinga, Belém - PA, 66610-770, Brazil

name: Praia do Cruzeiro
address: Tv. do Cruzeiro, 463-645 - Cruzeiro, Belém - PA, 66810-010, Brazil

detail_description: The Pará State Museum, located in the historic Palacio Lauro Sodre, has a rich history as the former residence of Portugal's royal representatives and state governors. The palace witnessed significant events such as the Cabanagem Rebellion, during which Governor Ernest Lobo was tragically killed on its stairs. This free museum offers an insightful look into the region's past. However, visitors should be mindful of its opening hours to ensure a smooth visit.
name: Pará State Museum
address: Praça Dom Pedro II, s/n - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-240, Brazil

excerpt: Imposing waterfront fortress constructed in 1616, now housing a museum on native indigenous culture.
detail_description: Presépio Fort, a waterfront fortress built in 1616, served as an observation station against native Indian attacks and invasions. It underwent several renovations and now houses a museum showcasing indigenous culture and colonial history. Restored in the 1980s, it offers panoramic views of the city and features artifacts from the indigenous past. Despite its small size, visitors can explore its rich history and enjoy stunning harbor views at an affordable cost.
name: Presépio Fort
address: Praça Dom Frei Caetano Brandão, s/n - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-600, Brazil
